description: Erection of a new dwellinghouse along with associated storage external landscaping, and other associated works following the demolition of existing structures on site.
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>Prior to the commencement of works, detailed drawings and full specifications of the proposed green/biodiverse roof shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submission shall include cross-sectional drawings (scale 1:20) confirming a minimum substrate depth of 80mm, excluding the vegetative mat; a planting plan incorporating a diverse mix of species, including native species beneficial to local wildlife; and a management and maintenance plan to ensure the long-term success of the green roof. The approved details shall be fully implemented and retained thereafter.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To promote biodiversity on site through green roofs, in line with Hackney's Local Plan LP33, policy LP46.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of the water butt with overflow shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To reduce the risk of flooding through SuDs, in line with Hackneyâs Local Plan LP33, policy LP53.</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved (including demolition and all preparatory work), a scheme for the protection of trees within or close to the site boundary, in accordance with BS 5837:2012, including details of tree protection measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: Required prior to commencement of development to satisfy the Local Planning Authority that the trees to be retained will not be damaged during demolition or construction and to protect and enhance the appearance and character of the site and locality, in accordance with Hackneyâs Local Plan Policy LP51.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development, details of secure, accessible, convenient, and weatherproof cycle parking facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted details shall include the number, type, layout, spacing, and security measures (including lighting, CCTV, and controlled access). The approved cycle parking shall be provided prior to occupation and retained in perpetuity. Two-tier cycle racks will not be supported unless it can be demonstrated they are accessible to all users.</p><p>Reason: To ensure adequate and inclusive provision for cyclists in line with Policies LP41, LP42 and LP43 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033, Hackneyâs Transport Strategy 2015-2025, and London Cycle Design Standards.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, full details must be submitted to and approved by the Local Authority to demonstrate at least the consented standards have been met, as set out in the hereby approved Energy Statement.</p><ul><li>Solar PV panels annual electricity peak generation of 2 kWp</li><li>Installation certificate by MCS register installer</li><li>As built roof plan (1:50) showing PV array, maintenance and access paths, other plants and services, landscaping including fire breaks where applicable</li><li>Final Operation &amp; Maintenance manual including fire risk assessment where applicable the development hereby approved shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thereby approved.</li></ul><div>REASON: To ensure the development achieves the anticipated on-site carbon reduction through renewable energy technologies in line with Policy LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan and Policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan, and to secure compliance with the approved Energy Strategy.</div>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, details of bird and bat box provision, including swift bricks, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details of the bird and bat box provision shall include details of: - A minimum of one swift bird box incorporated into the design of the development. The box shall be at or close to eaves level of the development, with a 5m drop beneath and in front of the box, hereby approved. - A minimum of one bat box incorporated into the design of the development, which should be at least 5m above ground and away from artificial light sources, hereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To enhance local biodiversity by providing nesting opportunities for birds, including swifts and habitat for bats, in line with Hackneyâs local plan policy LP47.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of development, a Detailed Planting Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include:&nbsp;</p><p>A diverse mix of species, including those adapted to changing climatic conditions and native species, which are known to have value to wildlife.&nbsp;</p><p>A varied plant structure, incorporating flowering plants, evergreen species, and shrubs to enhance habitat diversity.&nbsp;</p><p>A maintenance and management plan to ensure the long-term success of the planting scheme, including details on watering, monitoring, and replacement of failed plants. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved planting strategy and maintained thereafter.</p><p>&nbsp;REASON: To ensure the green roofs and habitats on site contribute positively to local biodiversity, provide habitat for pollinators and invertebrates, and support climate resilience in accordance with relevant environmental and sustainability policies.</p><div><br></div>

<p>No occupiers of the development hereby approved, with the exception of disabled persons who are Blue Badge holders, shall be eligible to obtain an on-street parking permit within any existing or future Controlled Parking Zone (CPZ). Prior to first occupation of the development, a legal agreement shall be entered into with the Council to secure this restriction.</p><p>Reason: To promote sustainable modes of transport and reduce reliance on the private car in accordance with Policy LP45 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and Policy T6 of the London Plan (2021).</p><div><br></div>

<p>No development shall take place, including any works of demolition, until a Construction Management Plan (CMP) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with the Councilâs Streetscene team. The CMP shall accord with TfLâs Construction Logistics Plan guidance and include details of construction access arrangements, traffic management, vehicle routes, timing of deliveries, noise and dust mitigation measures, and contact details for site managers. The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved CMP.</p><p><br></p><p>Reason: To mitigate the impact of construction on the highway network and the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policy LP2 and LP44 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and the London Plan Policy T7.</p><div><br></div>
